page.title: 07THE DOLPHIN SPORTS CENTRE
page.content: The Dolphin Sports Centre and swimming pool, which is situated in Filton, just off the A38-Gloucester Road, was built in 1971. The complex contains a swimming pool, a sports hall and outside tennis courts. There is also a bar and skittle alley. The swimming pool is used by 1373 people each week on average, with 17 schools using it during school time, having 10 lessons each day. The pool is 25 metres long by 10 metres wide, sloping from 3 feet at the shallow end to 6 feet at the deep end. The water is drained and filtered at a rate of 2,200 gallons per hour, and twice a week 2,000 gallons are removed and replaced. Swimming costs 65p for adults and 30p for juniors, with pensioners and spectators paying 20p.
